choices.A: Project management plan, work performance data, enterprise environmental factors, and organizational process assets
choices.D: Project management plan, enterprise environmental factors, basis of estimates, and organizational process assets
choices.C: Cost baseline, enterprise environmental factors, benefits management plan, and organizational process assets
choices.B: Project management plan, project documents, enterprise environmental factors, and organizational process assets

discussion.content: It's B. Each of the other choices contains an output of other processes. Work performance Data is an input of Control Cost.

comments.content: and basis of estimates is an input of Determine Budget process.

discussion.content: list of answers are not great...
B-PMP, Project Docs, OPA's, and EEF's-7.2

questions.question_text: What are the inputs of the Estimate Costs process?
In what type of organizational structure does a project manager develop their role and work with a team assigned by job function?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D . Functional: In a functional organizational structure, a project manager typically develops their role and works with a team assigned by job function. In this structure, employees report to a functional manager, and the project manager usually has less authority and may rely on functional managers to assign team members with specific expertise.

Selected Answer: B
Question is tricky it says....In what type of organizational structure does a project manager ''Develop their role'' and work with a team ''Assigned by job function''

Matrix - Balanced: Role is shared, and the project manager has more opportunities to develop and grow their responsibilities in PM & Functional areas.

Selected Answer: A
Pag 57 6th, matrix strong by job function and full time PM

Selected Answer: D
In a functional organizational structure, employees are grouped by their specialized job functions (e.g., marketing, engineering, finance). Project managers typically have limited authority and play a coordinating role. They work with team members who report to their respective functional managers.

Selected Answer: A
must be A, chart on pg 47 in 6th edition

Selected Answer: A
The right answer

Selected Answer: A
I'm sorry I meant to Say A!!!, page 47, Table 2-1. The project manager develops their role and the teams are developed by job function., matrix-strong.
D., page 47 Table 2-1.
Function - functional

must be A.

questions.question_text: In an adaptive project environment, which action helps the project manager ensure that the team is comfortable with charges?

choices.C: Selecting different team members to take the project manager role during reviews with stakeholders
choices.B: Giving access to information to the team and frequent team checkpoints
choices.A: Having control over the planning and delivery of the products without delegating decisions
choices.D: Asking the control change board to approve changes before notifying the team

questions.question_text: The project manager implemented the stakeholder engagement plan and realized that some updates should be made. Which components of the project management plan should be modified?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C for sure
C-Communications and Stakeholder mgmt plans

choices.D: Project charter and communications management plan
choices.B: Risk management plan and stakeholder engagement plan
choices.C: Communications management plan and stakeholder engagement plan
choices.A: Project charter and stakeholder engagement plan

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Control Costs (Proj. Costs)
- Work Performance Data is an output of Direct & Manage Project Work (Proj. Integration) and flows in as an INPUT of Control Costs
(TIP: Work Performance Data is an input for like all of the NON-integration M&C processes).
D-Control Costs-7.4

questions.question_text: In which Project Cost Management process is work performance data included?
